website_summaries.verdict: A versatile tire in a no-flat design that will save you ever having to purchase another wheelbarrow tire.
pros: Tire comes with an adapter kit and spacers to help you specially-fit to your wheelbarrow
No-flat design that is still pneumatic
This tire helps you save time by keeping you from having to refill
cons: Load capacity on this wheelbarrow tire is only 300 pounds, which is less than others available

customer_reviews.title: Time saver and works fine!
customer_reviews.text: Our wheelbarrow was about 25 years old, and the front tire had to be aired up every time I used it. I had put new handles on it a few years back. I ordered this flat free wheel and tire, it took less than 5 minutes to install, only one side of the axle carrier has to be unbolted, slipped in a spacer on each side, and it was good to go. It makes some scrunchy noises with a heavy load, but works fine. Rolls pretty easy, even with a full load of landscaping rock. And no more flat tires!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Sherrill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent retrofit for my wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent retrofit for my wheelbarrow. It's a bit narrower than the tubeless tire it replaced, but for my application, that's not a problem. It comes with enough different spacers (and two sizes of bearings) that it probably will fit virtually any wheelbarrow. I wondered whether the lesser "spring" in a flat-free wheel (vs. a tubed or tubeless pneumatic) would be a negative. Actually, in my opinion, it's not. Much of my use is for hauling bark mulch. With the more springy pneumatic wheel I once used, going over bumps tended to toss mulch out of the wheelbarrow (sort of like over-active shock absorbers). This doesn't happen with the more rigid, flat-free tire -- yet it's not too rigid. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: agathokles

customer_reviews.title: Slightly expensive, but well worth it...Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This is a HUGE improvement over fighting flat tires on my wheel barrows. Invariably, when I want to use my wheelbarrow, the tire was flat...even after buying an expensive new inner tube for one of my wheels. Total disaster. This flat-free wheel works like a champ and rolls pretty much like the original air tire (when it was properly inflated). I've now replaced this wheel on both of my wheelbarrows. Also, although slightly larger diameter than my original wheels, it works fine. No noticeable difference. Bottom Line: Slightly expensive, but well worth it...Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: R. Ross

customer_reviews.title: product arrived without included spacers and bearings. anyone could ...
customer_reviews.text: product arrived without included spacers and bearings. anyone could have seen it was not complete, as 2 spacers were attached to one wheel and nothing was attached to the other (i bought two). each wheel is supposed to include an array of 6 spacers and 2 bearings. so i had to send the whole thing back, wheels and all (what a waste) and wait again for the replacements, which i hope will be complete.
customer_reviews.author: Allan G. Kern

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking to upgrade to a simpler, low maintenance tire then look no further.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my wheelbarrow. Used it to replace a tire that was constantly flat every time I needed the wheelbarrow. Now I no longer have to worry about it or waste my time airing up a tire when I need my wheelbarrow. Easy to install. If you are looking to upgrade to a simpler, low maintenance tire then look no further.
customer_reviews.author: ormedic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and afford peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: This tire and rim are the perfect replacement item for my 2-wheel utility cart. The original pneumatic tire were constantly going flat, even with Slime stop leak in them. I have thorny 'goat heads' on my property and they can reek havoc with thin ply tires. These Flat Free tires are the only way to go, in my opinion. What you give up in cushion from the aired tires you make up for in peace-of-mind knowing you don't have to worry about getting a flat tire while your working... or when you're ready to work.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Cheap bearings
customer_reviews.text: The tire portion seams fine for the first 6 months. The bearings seem to be the cheapest thingd they could find, bronze bushing would be better. 80 lb bag of concrete is difficult to push and it sounds like the bearings are coming apart. I would hate to put more than 80 lbs in it. I'll probably replace the bearings with something decent and the update the rating.
customer_reviews.author: DblD22

customer_reviews.title: Great Wheel, very well made, heartily recommend.
customer_reviews.text: It's a wheel I would recommend to anyone. I found that the typical axle hole to be about 5/8ths of an inch, however, this company give you everything including two different sized (5/8 & 3/4) ball bearings, spacers, etc. I believe it's everything you will need for an easy install with a great fit for most any kind of a wheel barrow wheel that I know of. No more annoying flats...
customer_reviews.author: Glockman

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictures + Arrived with no spacers or extra bearings-PLASTIC ZIP TIE?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Stunned! The manufacturer attached the spacers and the extra bearings with a 1/8 thick PLASTIC ZIP TIE!!! A Plastic zip tie?!?!? SURPRISE!!! Mine arrived with a broken zip tie and no spacers nor extra bearings! I ordered a replacement and will hold off on returning this one until I've got the parts I need. Also, it's not a Marathon (as pictured), but a Carlisle.
customer_reviews.author: aerolark

customer_reviews.title: An old wheelbarrow restored
customer_reviews.text: These wheels salvaged an old 2 wheel barrow I had ignored for years.. The Stanley plastic tub and the oak handles needed a little cleaning..but, I had let the original tires with tubes basically rot. These wheels and solid tires are just right. The bearing that came installed in the new wheels fit my 3/4" axle. There are several others included with the package. I did use the spacers furnished to center the wheels. For $52.00 I have a new wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: R. Michael Green

customer_reviews.title: Retire Air Filled tires
customer_reviews.text: This is my first run flat tire. I used a lot of wheelbarrels most were all air filled tires. And it was pretty normal to have to do some sort of tire maintenance on them I just figured it was acceptable. This thing is like a regular tire has no air, it came with some attachments so I think it would fit just about any wheelbarrow. If you don’t have a wheelbarrow you should buy one especially if your kids are inside all the time on their iPhones kids need to use wheelbarrows more.
customer_reviews.author: ambann

customer_reviews.title: universal fit but not great!
customer_reviews.text: Tire came with adapters to sort of fit may sizes. But Tire is about 2 inches less diameter then original tire. And there are not enough Adapter Spacers to properly fit. I had to use 8 purchased washers to make the spacing right. So it works but the idea of paying $50 for a universal kit was to avoid doing a make shift solution. Overall, you will have less expensive and better results if you upfront measure the old tire and buy exactly what you need.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Person

customer_reviews.title: No more having to inflate tires
customer_reviews.text: Have replaced wheel barrow, gorilla cart and hand cart wheels with these. These are so much more durable and need no refilling with air. We live in an arid place where tires start to crack in a short time, so these tires are the ticket. We did have to modify both carts to install these though. Installing on wheel barrow was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: TrykaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Missing Adapter kit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these, on separate orders and neither one included the adapter kit. They are useless to me without the adapter. Product support gives an 800 number, I've tried multiple times to call and never get anything other than a busy signal. I'm gonna have to resort to the hassle of returning. If you need the adapters, don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: T. Voellinger

customer_reviews.title: The actual tire size is misleading, poor workmanship...
customer_reviews.text: Tire size on my wheelbarrow is 4.80x8. I guess when the description says "Compatible replacement sizes include: 4.80/4.00-8", evidently, it doesn't mean it is the same size. This tire is significantly narrower. It will work, but when it's muddy out, the narrower tires are more likely to cut through the mud as opposed to rolling over it, particularly when the load is heavier. The deal killer, however, was the simple fact that the threaded holes for the grease fittings were far too large and the fittings could not be tightened. This was true for both the wheels I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Rational

customer_reviews.title: Tired of flat tires
customer_reviews.text: I'm tired of flat tires on wheelbarrows, carts, Etc. so I tried one of these. A bit expensive, but it will be nice to be able to use things without having to service them every time. Eventually, I will probably replace all my pneumatic tires with these. Going to wait a year or so to see how this holds up. Want to check it for ruse, frozen bearings, UV degradation before I spend the money. Pretty much anything would be an improvement on those cheap Chinese tube tires.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good so far, looking forward to no more flat tires
customer_reviews.text: I've replaced the tire and innertube on my old wheelbarrow several times over the years. They never seem to last, since it has to be stored outdoors through all midwest seasons. So far this tire has worked as advertised. It was a drop-in replacement, though I could maybe use more spacers. It feels similar to an inflatable tire, even when loaded and running over my lumpy lawn. Only time will tell how well it lives up to the hype, though.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P

customer_reviews.title: Beware the bearings and grease fittings
customer_reviews.text: The wheel and tire seem to be acceptable quality. The bearings are cheap, but at least you get two different sizes. The grease fittings are junk. They weren't tightened in, trying to tighten them turns the angled fitting toward the wheel.. One broke in half when used. Be sure you have some metric 6 x 1.0 fittings on hand. I recommend angled, 45 or 90 degrees. Pray they're the right length that they'll tighten up without turning toward the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Bill from 336

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: This fit my wheelbarrow perfectly. I had to use the spacers that were already on my wheelbarrow as the ones with this packages were either too short or too long. Otherwise this was extremely easy to put on all by my self. And now i dont have to worry about a popped tire or inner tube or a lost pump.the tire is stiff so if it its a bumb it jostles anything in the barrow and doese not habe that "bounce" a traditional tire has.
customer_reviews.author: BB's

customer_reviews.title: No more flat tires!
customer_reviews.text: My wheelbarrow tire had a slow leak for most of the time I had it. Always had to pump it up before every use. Finally got tired of it and bought this guy. Swapped out in less than ten minutes, and no more flats. The outside of the tire is slightly spongy. It cushions things like a pneumatic tire would, although it adds a little rolling resistance, and it makes the tire feel like it needs a little more air for someone who doesn’t know about it. But it’s worth it for zero tire maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: High-Tech Redneck

customer_reviews.title: Great airless tires, buy them
customer_reviews.text: Found that these were terribly easy to put on my wheelbarrow , which was the only reason I didn't want to buy them, but it took about 10 minutes to pull off the old full of air tires, that were no longer full of air, and put these that do NOT depend on having air in the tires. They work great, and now I can get back to my work with my wheelbarrow. I really do believe they will be the last wheelbarrow tires I will need to buy for the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: moerschen

customer_reviews.title: Ready to go!
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these for my mower cart & am so glad I did! I always had to inflate one tire to do a job( it got so bad I actually had to do it several times during an all day job!). These tires are great & durable. I have a rocky, rooty, wooded 5 acre lot so I needed ones that would hold up in rough terrain. Very happy - I did have to sand my axle to get the wheel on, but easily done!😁
customer_reviews.author: drumore girl

customer_reviews.title: Spacers Limited & Limited Instructions
customer_reviews.text: The tire was great, although a bit narrower than the one I was replacing. It was, however, disappointing that insufficient (4) 5/8 inch spacers were included. I ended up having to use one of the 3/4 inch spacers (added to the four 5/8 inch spacers provided) to keep the tire centered on the axle. For now this is working okay, but...... Also the wheel hub includes a grease fitting, but there is no information regarding what type of grease, or how often, grease needs to be applied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great permanent tire for my wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.text: My inflatable tire on my relatively new wheelbarrow kept going flat. They're a bear to fix, and the tire people don't like them because they are unsafe to work with. This solid rubber tire will NEVER go flat. It looks nice, and was easy to install. The kit comes with various adapters for different kinds of wheelbarrows. I highly recommend. I can keep my wheelbarrow for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J. Zercher

customer_reviews.title: Simple replacement
customer_reviews.text: Excellent super easy long lasting wheelbarrel fix .I have 2 Jackson wheelbarrel tough blue plastic body's from the 80's. They are great only problem was flat tires .. Done buy this tire !! Comes with spacers an 8 year old can install it . I'm buying it again for my other barrel that has been idol with a flat .. Tractor supply wanted 50 plus dollars for solid tire . can't go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Michael walsh

customer_reviews.title: Easy on.
customer_reviews.text: My wheelbarrow is old, so I broke a couple of bolts getting the tubeless off, but putting this one on was a cinch - just the right spacers to fit in between the handles. Snapped my grease gun on the zerk and it's rolling fine - 20 minutes for the change.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Haligan

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but inferior
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this on my wheel barrow for 4 months. Clearly it is nice to never have to worry about airing it up but it definitely doesn’t share the characteristics of a traditional tire. It does not roll up onto things very well and is quite unruly in snow. Also it makes an annoying squishing sound. I thought about abandoning it but it does function well enough so I am keeeping it for the time being. It seemed to feel worse in the cold weather so maybe I will change my mind this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Sculpy

customer_reviews.title: Received different tire than was described.
customer_reviews.text: The ad and picture all say this tire is from “Marathon Industries”. The tire I received is from a different company (Carlyle). I wish I could get what is described in the ad. I can’t trust any of the specs if they can’t even get the brand name right.
customer_reviews.author: LynneA

customer_reviews.title: Good tires
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace the pneumatic tires that were always going flat on my Rubbermaid garden trailer. It took a bit of pounding to place the 3/4" hubs in them, using a socket as others have, but just a few minutes. I think these will be better than a pair I got at a store for another trailer, because these have grease fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement Tires for Cart with 3/4" Axle
customer_reviews.text: I mounted a pair of these on a 3/4" axle for a cart we pull behind our lawn tractor for gardening and light hauling. Had to change out the bearings from 5/8" to 3/4", and that was easily accomplished. I also used one of the included spacers, and it worked just fine. The angled zerk fittings will make greasing the bearings an easy task. No more flat tires!
customer_reviews.author: W. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Time saver and frustration eliminator.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great time saver. I use it on a 2 wheel around the yard trailer. One of the tire is always flat. It has some small pin holes for running over sharp branches. The other tire I have the green glue in the tire keep it from deflating. The leaky one just keep leaking. This tire is great . I don't have to worry about branches when I drive over the ground. Might replace the other one too.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Creek

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a different brand
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised to receive Carlisle branded tires instead of Marathon. But after doing research, I found that Marathon was acquired by Carlisle. Amazon should update the photos and description if they are only shipping Carlisle tires.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Never Flat Again-but a bumpy ride
customer_reviews.text: I like that in my situation where I use a wheel barrel on rare occasion it is never flat when I need it. However if I were a pro using this on a daily basis, a real tire is preferable for its shock absorbing value. Came with hardware to fit any configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas1963

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement Over Original Tire
customer_reviews.text: It was my firs time to change the tire on a wheelbarrow, and it was super easy. I hope not to have to do it again anytime soon; this one is not filled with air, but it sold and should last a lot longer. The instructions were really easy, and now I just need it to be a few degrees warmer so I can get to work on the Spring landscape improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Hilton Keith

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy, fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure this "universal" tire would fit my very old wheelbarrow - both the size of the shaft and the tire diameter worried me - but this replacement tire arrived in 2 days, it fit, slid right on, put the old bolts back on, and voila! Functioning wheelbarrow. And the tire will never go flat. Perfect and worry-free. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Susa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing thing
customer_reviews.text: Hard and sturdy, I can place so much weight into the wheelbarrow, my only limitation is the space. That wheel does not go flat or even soft. I just love it, one of the best investments I've made in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Eric V.

customer_reviews.title: No more flats for me!
customer_reviews.text: My wheelbarrow is the one where you buy the pan, the wooden bars, and the wheel as separate pieces and assemble them at home I think I bought it at Lowe's. It served for many years until I helper clean up from a roof tear-off at my home. Roofing nails and pneumatic tires don't mix. I bought this replacement. The instructions are easy to follow. With the spacers that arrived with the tire, it fit perfectly. My grandchildren will be pushing that wheelbarrow along 50 years from now. I'm happy. My money was very well spent.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chmielewski

customer_reviews.title: it all fit together just fine. I am really appreciative of flat free tires
customer_reviews.text: These flat free tires replaced two pneumatic tires on my wheelbarrow. I had to purchase an additional piece of 5/8" bar stock from Lowes to serve as an axle. The original wheelbarrow's axle was one inch. But, once the new axle was cut to size and drilled for cotter pins on the ends of the shaft, it all fit together just fine. I am really appreciative of flat free tires. DW
customer_reviews.author: David M. Wicka

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for my Wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: Finally! Inherited a great wheelbarrow from my parents when they moved into a condo - but the tire kept going flat. After some research, I decided to go with this as the replacement. Went on in about 15 minutes with the right tools and now, the wheelbarrow is perfect for my property. Easy to install and working perfectly. Recommended to anyone who needs a tire which will never need air!
customer_reviews.author: JonTheCanadian

customer_reviews.title: Will last longer than my poor old wheel barrow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to revive my old wheel barrow and I am not disappointed! The wheel is made very well and was simple to install with the spacers included in the packaging. I hauled a few big loads and it performed perfectly. Sadly the rest of the wheel barrow will probably wear out before the tire :)
customer_reviews.author: TX Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: No more flats
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and no more flat tires. I installed these on a small dump trailer that I pull with my riding mower. I have the larger axle, so I had to tap out the smaller bearing and insert the new ones. The small ones come out pretty easy, but the new ones are a little difficult to get in. Find a socket of the same size as the bearing to tap with a hammer. If not it will try to go in crooked.
customer_reviews.author: Snafu

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is quite expensive but I think it is worth the price paid. I replaced the pneumatic tire in about 3 minutes. The old wheel was 13" and this wheel is 16" and will allow me to traverse much "bumpier" ground and I really think that is quite a bonus. Very glad I made this switch and only wish I would have done so much sooner! Hai!
customer_reviews.author: Silver fox

customer_reviews.title: excellent replacement fit
customer_reviews.text: I have an older garden trailer used behind a JD 155. It doesn't get used much, and every time they need air, but the last 2 times they wouldn't hold air. I was tired of waiting for new tubes or tires. These fit perfectly, look sharp and never need air! they're ready to go when I am.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Groniger

customer_reviews.title: It's fine but pretty stiff.
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I will never have to deal with flats again, but this tire is quite stiff and there is no "bounce" like they claim, or if there is, I don't notice it. Still, this is WAY preferable to an inflated wheelbarrow tire and pumping it up, getting an innertube, adding slime, etc etc.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tanous

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Easy for a tool idiot. Works great. Had to use all the spacers for one of my wheelbarrows. The other needed none. Very pleased no more flats!
customer_reviews.author: cwc

customer_reviews.title: It rolls
customer_reviews.text: What can you say it rolls, easy install. Time will tell how it holds up. Just got tired of having to put air in my old tire every time I needed to use it. Which is not that often but maybe will use more now as I don't have to get out the air pump.
customer_reviews.author: Ron W.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy, extremely useful
customer_reviews.text: My wheelbarrow was becoming almost useless since anything heavy caused a flat tire. Tired of getting it fixed, I tried this solid one. I have now been able to transport what I think are reasonable loads without tire problems. Really wish I had done this sooner. Really easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Jane

customer_reviews.title: Love that the wheels are flat-free
customer_reviews.text: Picked up two of these for my ten-year-old garden cart that gets towed by a lawn tractor. Love that the wheels are flat-free. That does make the ride a little rougher but that beats having to inflate tires. Very easy to install, can be done with household tools such as a screwdriver and a hammer. Be sure to pick up new cotter pins!
customer_reviews.author: TopDog1

customer_reviews.title: Cheap bearings
customer_reviews.text: Thinner and stiffer than pneumatic wheels but they won’t go flat. My only complaint is the quality of the bearings. I had to remove the 5/8” bearing to install the 3/4” bearings and I crushed one of them while installing it. The metal is fairly thin and the bearings in my 20 year old pneumatic tires were of far higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: sabertootham

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but lower quality rubber and 30% thinner than air tires.
customer_reviews.text: This tire is considerably thinner than a normal air tire, so it will bog down in wet soil easier... as well the tread and thickness of the surface rubber is not the quality of the normal. The plastic inserts for spacing are also a bit rink dink for real wheelbarrow work. We'll see if it holds up. I got tired (no pun intended) of paying upwards of $30 for tires that lasted a season and decided to try these. If they were the same size and quality with solid foam inside, I'd give them a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: Sonoma Dan

customer_reviews.title: Worked!!
customer_reviews.text: I used it to replace the wheel in a wheelbarrow that I got from a friend who was moving from a house into a condo and would't need it anymore. It came with easy to follow instructions and all the parts to fit the wheelbarrow. Also, some "extra" parts for other wheelbarrow models. I believe it is truly "universal" and should fit your wheelbarrow model. After replacing the wheel, I put the wheelbarrow to heavy use carrying 60 pounds stone bags and the tire performed great.
customer_reviews.author: LEFA

customer_reviews.title: nice and round!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I totally believe a chimpanzee could get the job done (as long as they have a few basic do-it-yourself skills). I know what you're thinking - no way a chimp can get that done. Well bring one over and let's settle this and remember - no kibitzing!
customer_reviews.author: twetz

customer_reviews.title: Fits well and works great.
customer_reviews.text: I used these to replace the wheels that kept going flat on my tow behind dump trailer. They fit great on the 5/8” axle, and the extra inch of height make it easier to dump out yard debris that I pick up. Plus I don’t have to keep adding air to the flat tires.
customer_reviews.author: MotMan616

customer_reviews.title: Where’s the support?
customer_reviews.text: I have bought four of these wheels and they all have been great except the last wheel. It has a flat spot that makes my wheelbarrow bounce when pushing. I’d give this product a perfect score other than this one defective wheel, and that there is not a warranty for an obvious defective wheel.
customer_reviews.author: george harris

customer_reviews.title: no flait tire's
customer_reviews.text: These hub' bearing is very cheap, I had a 5/8 axle so I tried to drive in the larger bearing and they bent, and the hub's are too wide for axle on a Rubbermaid cart. and the tire is much smaller than the original tires
customer_reviews.author: Everett G.

customer_reviews.title: Meets my specifications...
customer_reviews.text: $8 cheaper online at around $20.00. The wheel is sturdy and I've used it for the past two weeks hauling firewood...held up great so far. I moved from a tube because it stayed flat...got tired of pumping and patching...If you want to see it in person before you buy it, head over to Home Depot or Lowes...
customer_reviews.author: Steve Austin

customer_reviews.title: EASY INSTALL
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product with some good planing behind it. it comes with enough different spacers to fit almost any application. Couldn't be happier. Now we will see how long it will last. Nice never having to add air though.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper John

customer_reviews.title: Never have to inflate!
customer_reviews.text: These allowed me to rebuild a well built wheel barrow that had inflated wheels that could not be replaced. The only problem is the bearings that are changeable, results in the ones removed being ruined for future use.
customer_reviews.author: elkhorne

customer_reviews.title: Quick to install
customer_reviews.text: This wheel was perfect to replace my old air filled tire. The variety of axle washers ensured it would fit mine, as well as various other model wheelbarrows. The install was quick and the tire is solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: D.E.C.

customer_reviews.title: Is this a joke. Ordered Marathon brand and got Carlisle
customer_reviews.text: The product description and pictures are wrong as I received a different product. I ordered this product for being a Marathon brand of flat free tire after reading good reviews about it. However, I got Carlisle brand which I am not sure about. Felt deceived and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Drogpa

customer_reviews.title: but it was easy, had to cut the 2 plastic spacers on ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit on my plastic body, wood handle wheelbarrow I bought from Home Depot. the wheel itself was a bit larger than the one it replaced, but it was easy, had to cut the 2 plastic spacers on my wheelbarrow for it to fit, but otherwise, works fine. Looking forward to never having to replace the tire again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave, Boston

customer_reviews.title: Wheelbarrow tire
customer_reviews.text: Very durable wheelbarrow tire. No more flats. I wish I would have purchased years ago. Holds a great deal of weight. Wheelbarrow feels more solid and stable now. Looks like it should last a lifetime and more.
customer_reviews.author: Frito

customer_reviews.title: Good tire
customer_reviews.text: The tire outlasted my first wheelbarrow and I installed it on another. I like not worrying about air in tire.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Evans

customer_reviews.title: Used on our little dump trailer for the 4 wheeler
customer_reviews.text: Only one we've found that fit the axle. Can knock out center to adjust axle size. We used the bigger size. Have had them on for a week or so so we can't really vouch for longevity, but its an only option.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be durable construction. Time will tell. Easy to assemble. Functions nicely. Was a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: patricia levin

customer_reviews.title: It worked but was not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a Marathon specific model wheelbarrow tire to match the other tire I bought at another retailer for my wheelbarrow(both were flat other retailer only had one). I specifically searched for the Marathon tire so I had an exact match in size and tread. I received a Carlisle Universal flat free tire which is not what is pictured or described. I installed easily with adapters and will live with the different treads because it is just a wheelbarrow. Just wanted to warn buyers that you shouldnt count on the actual brand item described to be provided.8
customer_reviews.author: TCM

customer_reviews.title: Not too easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: This was not as easy to install as l was led to believe. With only minimal instructions and only one spacer I got it to go. It seems to work. Not as soft as air, but I don’t need to pump it up as much.
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade to a wheelbarrow!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and very easy to install. Comes with necessary adapters to fit most wheelbarrows. The wheelbarrow I had kept getting flat tires and that can put a vault on a project. So this was a great upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Van Slyke Summers

customer_reviews.title: No more airing wheelbarrow at every use!
customer_reviews.text: With the use of the spacers that come with it, this wheel was the perfect fit and replacement for the one that originally came on my wheelbarrow. Now I won't have to get out the air compressor every time I go to use my wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L Huff

customer_reviews.title: Great tire replacements!!
customer_reviews.text: I used the non flat tire to replace the pneumatic tire on my garden trailer, this is the second tire I have used to replace a tire on that trailer. I'm very satisfied with the tires. No longer have to deal with the tires going flat.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Been working for 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because of repeated problems with flat tires on my wheelbarrow. I purchased this and it has been working for 2 years! I'm satisfied and am going to buy 2 for my garden cart!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Bell

customer_reviews.title: It's nice that it comes with two different bearing sizes and ...
customer_reviews.text: They are round, they fit, and they won't go flat. Can't complain about that. Wish they didn't cost so much but as long as they last, they will be worth it. It's nice that it comes with two different bearing sizes and a variety of spacers. My wheelbarrow has two wheels so I had to buy two of them, hence my comment about the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Olson

customer_reviews.title: easy install
customer_reviews.text: my previous original wheel barrow wheel, went flat, and this new tubeless seems to be strong and is doing a good job. Not sure of the longevity. I thought it a bit pricey, but it is what it is....
customer_reviews.author: Adnan J.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when changing the bearing hubs
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Be careful when changing the bearing hubs from 1/2" to 3/4". It is a tight fit and you can easily damage the hub when driving it on forcefully. Make sure you have it straight first. Use a bearing press if you have access to one.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Hoaglund

customer_reviews.title: This is a great replacement, saves time and labor
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriends wheelbarrow tire was always going flat. Had to fix the flat before we could get to the yard work. This is a great replacement, saves time and labor. Finally broke down and bought one for my wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This works. I live in AZ with lots of cacti, goathead weeds, and thorny trees. Before buying this I was having a tire patched on my lawn equipment once a week. Now, never again!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Never worry about the air in the tires again!
customer_reviews.text: I can forget about the air in my wheelbarrow tire. It's always ready to go! I tried the green stuff but it didn't work. This is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: A. Beauchene

customer_reviews.title: No More Flats
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product and very easy to install, only took 5 minutes. As all those out there that use a wheelbarrow on a regular basis know, no matter how often you need it the tire always seems to be flat. NO MORE FLATS!!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because my wheel barrow is 50 years old. However, with the included spacers, it fits perfectly and no more flat tires!!!!! I hated using my wheelbarrow because the tire was always flat. I only wish I had known about this indestructible product sooner!!!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip R. Semenick

customer_reviews.title: I have several wheelbarrows. I have flat free tires ...
customer_reviews.text: I have several wheelbarrows. I have flat free tires on them from a different manufacturer. The others are a more substantial tire. The others are higher floatation tires. Something I need as I work in the Mojave Desert of California .The Marathon 00265 tire is narrow or skinny and sinks into loose soil when the wheelbarrow is hauling a load. To compensate for this , I carry smaller loads . .
customer_reviews.author: John Griffin

customer_reviews.title: No more flat tires on the wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area that has an abundance of evil thorny weeds that killed at least three wheelbarrow tubes each summer. Now I am killing them instead with great pleasure. Fit correctly and is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Regie T

customer_reviews.title: I will never buy another small air tire because 99% are junk chinese garbage rubber. Marathon has the best website for small ...
customer_reviews.text: No more jacking around with flat leaky implement tires. I will never buy another small air tire because 99% are junk chinese garbage rubber. Marathon has the best website for small tires on the net. If you order the wrong offset or axle diameter or any other dimension after going to their site well i'll just say you're not the sharpest knife in the drawer. This is my second set from Marathon.
customer_reviews.author: Pat J

customer_reviews.title: Universal... for most
customer_reviews.text: Not necessarily universal. Even with all of the pieces it doesn't fit properly on my Ames True Temper 6 cubic feet steel wheelbarrow. Although it doesn't fit properly... it still works. And it got me through my latest project without a flat.
customer_reviews.author: RDSWY4

customer_reviews.title: Not for a 1" axel
customer_reviews.text: The wheel itself is OK but I had to ask the company to send a special adaptor for my 1" axel ( which they did promptly), but it did not have any bearing so my wheel seems to scrape the adaptor despite much lube.
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! I had to use the bushings/spacers provided to make it fit my wheelbarrow. But, that's one of the reasons I bought this. The attached pic is a close up if it installed, with the bushings/spacers. The existing axle is the perfect size, so I did not have to use the provided pieces.
customer_reviews.author: B. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Bearing problem
customer_reviews.text: My trailer has a 3/4 in axle. The 3/4 in. bearings supplied with the wheel would not fit on the new wheels at all. I had to remove the bearings (which were still good) from my old wheels and install them on the new wheels before I could mount them on the trailer. Inexcusable!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Pushes Easy
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the tire is solid no air needed. Being able to grease the bearings is a feature I really like. The spacers supplied makes it easy to center the tire.
customer_reviews.author: JR7

customer_reviews.title: Fits good
customer_reviews.text: Husband said this fit his wheelbarrow perfect and he was happy we found it! We could not find a replacement tire at our local home store, so I found this on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: debbie jo

customer_reviews.title: Quality tire, missing were rods to keep in place
customer_reviews.text: Exact size and great quality tire. Upon initial use, the wheel shifted back and forth, getting stuck under the wheelbarrow. Cut some spare metal pipe to keep centered.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Good Wheel
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Tire if you're not using everyday. If I had to use a wheelbarrow more often, would prefer it to be a softer ride. Since this is for a wheelbarrow that isn't used to much, great solution. Is what it is, easy to install appreciate all the spacers to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This fit our OLD wheelbarrow fine.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace our flat tire on our old, old wheelbarrow and was hoping that this new one would work. Well, it did and I am pushing the thing as I did 20 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Turtledove82

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a super old deflated tire on an ancient wheelbarrow. Fits perfectly and should last quite some time. I suspect it will last longer than the wheelbarrow itself.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey P.

customer_reviews.title: working great!!
customer_reviews.text: bought these to replace substandard tires that came with a cart we bought from Tractor Supply (GroundWork 10-Cube Trailing Dump Cart $99) We did have to buy an extended axle from a local machine shop to accommodate the hubs (think it was 32" rod for about $25) but have had no issues! working great!!! Bearings are accessible which is important in a dry dusty environment.
customer_reviews.author: Mishelle A. McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit our 3/4” axle
customer_reviews.text: The tire is good, but it does not fit our 3/4 inch axle. It’s a fraction of an inch too small. We have to now find it have cut a smaller axle or send this back. We are not sure why it doesn’t fit. Our axle is definitely 3/4.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Impervious to Goatheads
customer_reviews.text: These tires work great. Where I live there is a weed known as a goathead that has sharp, pointy burrs. It is notorious for puncturing tires on bicycles, riding lawn mowers and wheelbarrows. My wheelbarrow is the kind that has two tires and at times both would be flat from damage inflicted by the goatheads. Once I replaced the pneumatic tires with these flat free ones, it was problems solved. I can now concentrate on the task at hand instead of having to worry about flat tires.
customer_reviews.author: Lawren5

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for Lawn Cart
customer_reviews.text: Used for replacement of a tractor cart wheel. Easy to install. Appears to be a quality product and expect it to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: GodBlessAmerica

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a tire that keeps going flat
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install. But I had to cut the supplied spacers to center the wheel centered. A PVC pipe cutter did the job easily.
customer_reviews.author: pX

customer_reviews.title: thanks - as described
customer_reviews.text: adapters make this fit various wheelbarrows - thanks and was easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Mash

customer_reviews.title: Fits Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly using some of the adapters included. I was leary of the “no flat” seems like a really strong material, and $6 cheaper than Home Depot!
customer_reviews.author: reinventress

customer_reviews.title: The order is incomplete
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 tires and wheels, when they were delivered one wheel had the adapter kit fastened to it the other wheel didn't have the adapter kit. I have tried to call Marathon Industries for 2 days now and get nothing but a busy signal. I can not use this wheel without the adapter kit
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Universal Fit, Flat Free Wheelbarrow Tire and Wheel Assembly with Adapter Kit
product_meta.description:
Style:Flat Free

Eliminate downtime with the Marathon Universal Fit Flat Free Wheelbarrow Tire and Wheel Assembly. It is the perfect replacement for most wheelbarrows, including popular brands like Ames True Temper, Jackson, Seymour, Truper, United General, Yard Rover and more. The tire is 14.5" in diameter and can be used as a replacement for 13", 15" or 16" diameter tires. It is made of solid, polyurethane foam that has the same bounce and handling feel as an air-filled tire. It won't leave marks on any surfaces and will not deteriorate when left exposed to sun or moisture. Best of all, it’s guaranteed to never go flat. Tire markings and packaging may vary.


The Marathon brand features a full line of air filled and flat free tire and wheel assemblies for lawn and garden and commercial/industrial equipment. This includes universal fit and exact match options to accommodate nearly every application. Count on Marathon for quality, easy-to-install products at a great value.


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Universal Fit Flat Free Wheelbarrow Tire is made of solid polyurethane foam. This tire replaces the following tire sizes: 3.50/2.50-8", 4.00-6", and 4.80/4.00-8". No flat tires have the same bounce, feel, cushion, and performance as pneumatic (air-filled) tires. They are also non-marking and will not be affected by Ozone or UV rays. Airless Tires are made of lightweight, solid polyurethane foam and are guaranteed to never go flat. Tire is 14.5" in diameter, comes standard with a 3" centered hub and 5/8" Ball Bearings. Includes adapter kit with additional bushings and spacers to fit your wheelbarrow - Adapter kit includes the following items: (4) - 1/2" Spacers, (2) - 1" Spacers, (2) - 3/4" Ball Bearings (5/8" installed)
feature_bullets: Fits most wheelbarrows and small lawn and garden equipment. Compatible Replacement Sizes include: 4.80/4.00-8" (15-16” diameter), 3.50/2.50-8" (13” diameter), and 4.00-6" (13” diameter)
Features a ribbed tread that is easy to maneuver, a solid white wheel and a load capacity of 300 pounds
Comes with a 3" centered hub and 5/8" ball bearings installed and an adapter kit to fit hub lengths up to 6" and 3/4" axle.
Adapter kit includes: (4) 1/2" long spacers, (2) 1" long spacers and (2) 3/4" ball bearings.
Has the same feel and handling of an air-filled tire, but the solid polyurethane will never go flat. Not for highway use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,122 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
